div.p: Illustration of the various types of tipping encountered in the vicinity of the bistable region of a subcritical bifurcation according to the classification proposed in [ 12]. Solid and dashed black lines: deterministic attractor and repeller, respectively. Light to dark hues: low to high probability density. ( aâ€“ c) B-tipping, rate-delayed tipping and N-tipping. ( d) Present work where B-, N- and rate-delayed tipping mechanisms occur simultaneously (see figure 4 for the experimental data).
